Comment: They do.  The problem is voters don't often turn out.  While 60% might be a near record for a Presidential election it's still disgustingly low.  Primaries are even worse.  I live in OR one of the highest voter turn out states in the country (because we're all mail in ballots) and primary turnout is anywhere between about 35-50% and I'd wager upwards of 2/3-3/4 of that are people over 40.  You won't get representation you want unless you vote, every election, every year, and some times it takes a LOT of elections to win.
